action.content: Turn 0

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Write your plan for your next actions on the line below your action, starting with "Next actions:".
For example:
> open cupboard
Next actions: take orange, eat orange

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the book on the table, the plate on the table and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a pillow and a bed. The wardrobe is closed. The pillow is on the bed. There is a passage to a living room here.

> open wardrobe
Next actions: take book, close wardrobe

> take book
Next actions: put book on table, take plate, close wardrobe

> put book on table
Next actions: take plate, put plate on table, take mop, put mop on table

> take plate
Next actions: put plate on table, take mop, put mop on table

> put plate on table
Next actions: take mop,
Turn 1
The wardrobe is now open. The wardrobe is empty.

> take mop
Next actions: put mop on table, put plate on table, put book on table

> put mop on table
Next actions: put plate on table, put book on table, done
